news.title: Awarded from Prix Ars Electronica 2015
brief: Next week, FIBER presents Coded Matters; a new event exploring the explosion of digital processes taking place in hybrid art, design and music and the ripples this causes. The ninth edition of the Coded Matter(s) series : High Fidelity will take place at the Brakke Grond centre on June 18th.
At this edition of the Coded Matter(s) Elliot will give a keynote presentation on the work and research of the studio, along with a 2-day workshop on the new Rulr toolkit.

news.title: Awarded from Prix Ars Electronica 2015
brief: The Prix Ars Electronica is the world’s most time-honored media arts competition. The categories in 2015 are Computer Animation / Film / VFX, Digital Musics & Sound Art, Hybrid Art and [the next idea] voestalpine Art & Technology Grant competition. A total of 2,889 entries from 75 countries were submitted for prize consideration to the 2015 Prix Ars Electronica.
On May 26, 2015 results announced for 2015 Prix Ars Electronica. 「Light Barrier, 2014」 wins Honorary Mention in Hybrid Art category.

news.title: Workshop at Node 15 Forum for Digital Arts
brief: The biennial festival NODE – Forum for Digital Arts gathers designers, creative coders, digital artists and creatives of the digital media scene since 2008.

Elliot Woods of Kimchi and Chips is having a workshop 'Ways of Seeing (with Computers)' in this forum. This workshop introduces Rulr, an open source node-based tool for calibrating artistic devices with the physical world.

news.title: Lecture and Workshop at Resonate ‘15
brief: Resonate is a festival which lasts for six days each year and provides an overview of the current situation in the fields of music, visual arts and digital culture. Guest artists, Kimchi and Chips presents a lecture on Saturday, 18th of April 12pm in Kolarac main hall.
And Elliot Woods of Kimchi and Chips is having workshop on Tuesday introducing Rulr, an application for calibrating artistic devices with the physical world.

news.title: Exhibition at STRP Biennale 2015
brief: Throughout the year, the STRP Biennale organises activities that allow both interested audiences and insiders to experience the extent to which existing new technology reaches into our visual and popular culture, the arts, but also our everyday lives.

In the exhibition, titled SCREEN ON | NO SCREEN, visitors are encouraged to explore the boundaries between the many screens that shape our view of the world around us. Kimchi and Chips presents bigger version of 「Light Barrier, 2014」.

news.title: Conference at Museums and the Web 2015
brief: Museums and the Web is an annual conference featuring advanced research and exemplary applications of digital practice for cultural, natural and scientific heritage.

Kimchi and Chips is presenting 'Digital Emulsion' in this conference. This workshop invites participants to practise Digital Emulsion techniques, a process which encompasses projection mapping and 3D scanning in order to create semi-material objects. We will learn new possibilities for drawing in the air, and ways to develop interesting volumetric canvases.

news.title: Awarded from Japan Media Arts Festival
brief: The Japan Media Arts Festival is a comprehensive festival of Media Arts that honors outstanding works in the four divisions of Art, Entertainment, Animation, and Manga, as well as providing a platform for appreciation of Award-winning Works.

For the 18th festival, JMAF received a number of 3,853 works from 71 countries and regions, including 1,818 entries from abroad. And Kimchi and Chips' latest work, 「Light Barrier, 2014」 is selected in jury selection.

news.title: Exhibition at Jeju Museum of Art
brief: Jeju Museum of Art presents a outstanding exhibition, 'From Moment to Moment' in December 2014. This exhibition will unfold aspects of visual perception and cognition which have been developed more colorfully in the perse spectra of today’s media environment, exhibiting aspects of 20st century contemporary art that have borrowed or applied features of optical art.
Kimchi and Chips present a new version of Line Segmnets Space, 「483 Lines, 2015」 at the exhibition 'From Moment to Moment', Jeju Museum of Arts.

news.title: Awarded from Media Architecture Biennale 2014
brief: For the second time, Media Architecture Biennale Awards were given will to outstanding projects at the intersection of architecture, media and interaction design. This happened at an award ceremony at Aarhus City Hall on November 21, 2014. Three projects were nominated in each of the five categories.
Winning project in Spatial Media Art category is Kimchi and Chips’ latest work, 「Light Barrier, 2014」. Other nominees in this category were SPINE by Kollision, Human Being by The Constitute.

news.title: Published Feature at SPACE Magazine
brief: Korean architecture journal, SPACE Magazine feature 「Light Barrier, 2014」 in Imagineer section 'Drawing Multilayered Time and Space with light' by independent curator, Dooeun Choi.

Monthly magazine SPACE was first founded in November 1966 and has been one of the top architectural magazines in Korea ever since. SPACE deals with cities, cultures, and art in relation to architecture.

news.title: Exhibition at SIGNAL Festival
brief: SIGNAL | Prague Light Festival is the largest showcase of light art and emerging technologies in the Czech Republic. It is also the most-visited cultural event. Its first edition attracted almost 250,000 visitors.

SIGNAL festival presents a brand new installation from Korean-British duo Kimchi and Chips. In their latest work, 「Light Barrier, 2014」, they create phantoms of light in the air, crossing millions of calibrated beams. The light installation creates floating graphic objects which animate through space as they do through time.

news.title: Exhibition at Whanki Museum
brief: Kimchi and Chips invite you to the exhibition Site Whanki_Wave, an international collection of works using Sound, Light and Space as their medium. The preview will be on the 22nd August at the magnificent Whanki Museum in Seoul and will be ongoing until 31st December. Kimchi and Chips will be presenting 「LINE SEGMENTS SPACE, 2013」 and 「LINK, 2010」.

news.title: Exhibition at Scopitone Festival
brief: Scopitone is a week-long festival of digital arts and electronic cultures. Held in Nantes every September, it offers a concentrate of today’s musical and digital creativity, mixing music, video, design, interactivity, robotics, architecture and more.

news.title: Exhibition at Da Vinci Creative 2014
brief: Kimchi and Chips' Mimi Son is this year's Artistic Director for the 'Da Vinci Creative' festival in collaboration with Seoul Art Space Gumcheon. The programme commissions 10 new works which develop the language for visual and digital media, and culminates in a festival of workshops, exhibition, performances and talks.
This year will also feature the Asian premier of Kimchi and Chips' 「Light Barrier, 2014」.

news.title: Exhibition at New Media Night
brief: On 5 July 2014 Nikola-Lenivets art-park will host The Night of New Media, one of the biggest festivals of digital art and music in Russia. Hundreds of people will join together for the all-night show to celebrate the possibilities of new media art combined with landscape art-objects in the natural environment of the 650 acre park.

As part of The Night of New Media, British Council Russia will present two large-scale installations. British multimedia artists Kimchi and Chips will take part with their 「Light Barrier, 2014」, and the winning Russian team from the Culture Shift Russia: Digital Emulsion workshop will create a light show with cinematic elements entitled HIDDEN.

news.title: Workshop at EYEO 2014
brief: Kimchi and Chips are speaking in the festival on Friday under the session title ‘Drawing in the Air’.

Mimi Son and Elliot Woods talk about their ongoing wander between the realms of material and immaterial, creating speculative visual objects which poke at the unpredictable attributes of things when they are touched with technology.

news.title: Open Studio at Seoul Art Space Geumcheon
brief: Kimchi and Chips preview a set of wind paintings. Their latest work draws a boundary between virtual and physical worlds through long exposure photography and a canvas of digitised fabric. This work is previewed at the Open Studio along with works by the other residents of the Seoul Art Space Geumcheon.

news.title: Workshop at Culture Shift Russia : Digital Emulsion
brief: FutureEverything(Manchester's R&D hub for digital culture) and the British Council, in partnership with Nikola-Lenivets Art Park, are hosting a second Culture Shift/Art Lab on 22-25 May, 2014. The 48-hour hackathon will generate ideas and installation projects for Nikola-Lenivets' big annual New Media Night (which takes place on 5 July 2014).

news.title: Talks and Exhibition at Resonate 2014
brief: Kimchi and Chips are speaking in the symposium on Saturday and present a new installation in collaboration with Andreas Müller following on from Line Segments Space.

news.title: Symposium and Workshop at DF14 : The Distortion Field Conference 2014
brief: Curated in collaboration between EWHA’s Cross Media Creative Lab, Kimchi and Chips and CreativeApplications.Net, The  「Distortion Field」 objective is to facilitate a productive ‘scenius’ that nurtures creative intersections, exchanges and networks between practitioners in art, media, performance and technology. It aims to describe the effect of audience’s participation upon artist’s intention, the opportunity for audience collaboration within new media creations, and the professional framing of artworks through curation and documentation.

news.title: Talks at INST-INT 2013
brief: Kimchi and Chips present a talk on their Digital Emulsion research at the INST-INT symposium. A gathering focused on sharing insights + experiences from the field of interactive installation.

news.title: Talk at SADI
brief: Open lecture talks by Mimi of Kimchi and Chips.

news.title: Exhibition at OPEN CREATIVITY OPEN WORLD
brief: Kimchi and Chips present a new edition of Lit Tree as part of ArtCenter Nabi's exhibition Open Creativity, Open World. This exhibition was organized in conjunction with Seoul Conference on Cyberspace 2013.

news.title: Resident Artist at Seoul Art Space Gumcheon
brief: Kimchi and Chips begin their residency as artists at Seoul Art Space Gumcheon.

news.title: Exhibition at 2013 Davinci Idea
brief: Kimchi and Chips present a new work, Line Segments Space at the exhibition 'The Blue Hour : Boundary between Functions and aesthetics', Seoul Art Space Geumcheon.

news.title: Exhibition and Keynote talk at LUX Wellington 2013
brief: Kimchi and Chips present Lit Tree 2013 a new outdoor commission as part of WGTN LUX's Urban Alive exhibition.

news.title: Conference at FutureEverything 2013
brief: Elliot Woods of Kimchi and Chips joins the curatorial team of FutureEverything, bringing a new Creative Coding strand to the conference.

news.title: Workshop at KIDP (Korea Institute of Design Promotion)
brief: Mimi Son of Kimchi and Chips gives a Service Design Workshop at KICP(Korea Institute of Design Promotion). This program develops the capacity of new designers looking for employment.

news.title: openFrameworks Workshop at Tokyo University
brief: Elliot Woods teaches openFrameworks lectures at the Ishikawa Oku laboratory at The University of Tokyo.

news.title: Talk at Media Art and Money Conference
brief: Mimi Son is a panelist at the Media Art and Money freestyle conference.

news.title: TEDx University of Manchester
brief: TED is a non-profit organization devoted to ‘ideas worth sharing.’ TEDx is an independently organised TED event linked to a specific location, in this case The University of Manchester. Speakers include Professor Clive Agnew, Shahbaz Hussain, Elliot Woods, Professor Julian Dodd and Nancy Elizabeth.

news.title: Workshop and Keynote presentation at NODE 13
brief: NODE13 is packed with hands on vvvv workshops where you’ll learn how to build stuff. You’ll get tons of chances to get to know each other and talk about the tools that we use in our everyday creative coding life.
Elliot Woods presents independant artwork ExR3, gives a presnetation as part of the keynote, and teaches 2 workshops on use and deveopment of computer vision within the VVVV environment.

news.title: Workshop at CulturalShift Zimbabwe
brief: Culture Shift believes in the creation of new technology tools and products that support the development of emerging creative businesses and cultural organisations around the world.
Elliot Woods gives guidance to help participants develop their own creative ideas into feasible businesses.

news.title: Professional VVVV Workshop at Figment Productions
Talk at Lux festival
brief: Elliot will present Kimchi and Chips’ provocations towards possible visual futures, a brief discussion on sight perception, and the influence of intermediation for visual art projects.

news.title: Curation at ScreenLab 0x02
brief: ScreenLab 0x02 Residency MediaCityUK

news.title: Student Workshop, Manchester
brief: 3D projection-mapping pro Elliot Woods is coming back to the Omniversity to run vvvv Workshops.

news.title: Talk at Flying Tokyo
brief: As part of Rhizomatiks' ongoing Flying Tokyo talks programme, Elliot presents Kimchi and Chips work and processes

news.title: Talk at Social Media Cafe
brief: SMC_MCR is a monthly meetup for anyone and everyone interested in digital innovation and social media in Manchester. We get together, share ideas and learn from each other.
Elliot Woods presents the work and processes of studio Kimchi and Chips

news.title: Exhibition at Science Gallery
brief: A major exhibition and events programme that invites you to adapt a hacker mindset to bend. Tweak and mask-up Dublin's existing urban systems.
Kimchi and Chips present new commission A Journey - Dublin.

news.title: Research collaboration with BERG & Google Labs
brief: Timo, Jack, Joe and Nick – with Chris Lauritzen (then of Google Creative Lab), and Elliot Woods of Kimchi and Chips, started a series of tests to investigate both the interactive and aesthetic qualities of the combination of projection and computervision.

news.title: Curation at ScreenLab 0x01
brief: ScreenLab 0x01 residency in MediaCityUK, hosted by the University of Salford and organized by Kit Turner and Elliot Woods.

news.title: Exhibition at Water Museum
brief: Kimchi and Chips present their newly commissioned work Assembly in Nakdong river cultural centre gallery in Busan.

news.title: Exhibition at SIGGRAPH Asia
brief: LIT TREE was installed in the exhibition at SIGGRAPH Asia, Hongkong.

news.title: Workshop at Art&&Code, Carnegie Mellon University
brief: ART && CODE: DIY 3D Sensing and Visualization was a festival and conference concerned with the artistic, technical, tactical and cultural potentials of low-cost 3D scanning devices — especially, but not exclusively, including the revolutionary Microsoft Kinect sensor.
Elliot takes part as artist and residence and in the talks programme

news.title: Exhibition at TETEM Kunstruimte
brief: The duo Kimchi and Chips presented the interactive installation Link - playful cityscape of cardboard boxes in which beautiful, funny or memorable stories preserved and can be shared.

news.title: Exhibition at The Creators Project
brief: Lit Tree is an augmented projection that responds to viewers’ gestures, using plants as volumetric canvases. The installation, made from a cloud of glittering, dancing voxels, was one of the premiere artworks featured at the Seoul Event.

news.title: Workshop at University of Seoul
brief: Creative technology workshop with masters students at The University of Seoul.

news.title: Exhibition at File Festival
brief: A Link was installed at File Festival, Sao Paulo.

news.title: Exhibition at Athens Video Art Festival
brief: A Link was installed at Athens Video Art Festival.

news.title: Exhibition at FutureEverything
brief: Lit Tree was installed at FutureEverything Art Exhibition.

news.title: Workshop at Kaywon School of Art and Design
news.place: Kaywon School of Art and Design, Seoul

news.title: Exhibition at Design Korea 2010
brief: Kimchi and Chips present their new commission A Link, developed in response to the them 'Convergence' of Design Korea 2010.

news.title: Workshop at NODE 10
brief: ‘Projecting On The Things’ is a workshop served up by Chris Plant (catweasel) and Elliot Woods (sugokuGENKI) covering techniques and topics on the art of projection mapping.

news.title: Exhibition at Bains Numeriques #5
brief: A Journey - Seoul and A Journey - London are installed at Bains Numeriques #5.

news.title: Exhibition at FutureEverything
brief: A Journey - London installed at FutureEverything 2010.

news.title: Exhibition at SIGGRAPH Asia 2009
brief: Litescape installed at SIGGRAPH Asia 2009, Yokohama

news.title: Exhibition at From Adam to Yeves
brief: A Jouney - London was installed at From Adam to Yeves.
